page.title: 01Char Valley and Charmouth
page.content: This is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty on the West Dorset Heritage Coast. The delightful rolling hills, many topped by attractive coppices, display a pleasing patchwork of hedged fields. this is farming country. The rich pasture land supports fifteen small farms, mainly dairy and sheep but with a little arable, around the ancient hamlets of Wootton Fitzpaie,Catherston Leweston and Whitchurch Canonicorum. Never a railway here, the main traffic artery is the A35 Trunk Road leading through to West country. The river Char meanders idly through this landscape to reach the sea at Charmouth with its spectacular lias and greensand cliffs where Jurassic fossils abound. Charmouth is a 'conservation Area' village, with Georgian and Regency buildings
